alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 10:14PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington, northeastern Hancock and south central Penobscot Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Grand Falls, or 26 miles east of Old Town, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherryfield, Harrington, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls, Columbia, Deblois, Grand Falls, Centerville, Greenbush, Addison, Passadumkeag, Lowell, Argyle, Whitneyville, Northfield, Aurora, Wesley, Great Pond, Beddington and Greenfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 near mile marker 211. US Highway 1 between Harrington and Columbia Falls. State Highway 9 near Junction 193. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot
